title: Can I publish my script as a Kindle book on Amazon? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure, you can. I have published 17 Kindle books during the last 2 years. Most of them were scripts. But I have an advice for you. Nowadays you can publish anything on Amazon but if quality matters to you then take care of these tasks before hitting the big, shiny Publish button. Hire a proofreader/editor and listen to their suggestionsDesign an eye catching coverFormat your manuscipt to look good on different ebook readersRead at least one or two popular articles on amazon self-publishing and book marketing (keywords, description, title and subtitle, kindle unlimited, pricing, etc.)Self-publishing is a beautiful journey and I encourage you to try it out. Experiencing that someone reads your hard work and likes it is one of the most uplifting things and author can imagine! Good luck!

You certainly can. But I would ask, what is the purpose? If you want to publish it as a book first in order to raise interest for your movie or play or whatever, that makes sense. It certainly could help. But if you simply print the script, I can’t see the purpose of it. But either way, you certainly can do it.
Not a good idea. The reason is formatting. A script requires very specific formatting that Kindle probably can't deal with. (Special headers, footers, page numbers, etc.)
You sure can. You really can publish almost anything you want, as long as it follows amazon’s guidelines.
